arts.ttl: Champions League: Ramos, Nuno Mendes, Le√£o on target, Fonseca unhappy despite Milan win
arts.sum: It was a strong week for Portuguese goalscoring in the Champions League, not least for Gon√ßalo Ramos who continued his recent comeback with a goal for Paris Saint-Germain against Salzburg. Nuno Mendes also scored in the French champions‚Äô 3-0 victory in Austria, while there was another goal for in-form Rafael Le√£o as Paulo Fonseca‚Äôs AC Milan secured a closely-fought win over Red Star Belgrade at San Siro. Gon√ßalo Ramos scored his first goal of the season against Salzburg in Austria on Tuesday evening, his first time hitting the net since April. The former Benfica man missed the first three months of the season with an ankle injury, before returning to action for Paris Saint-Germain towards the end of last month. Having started the 0-0 draw at Auxerre in Ligue 1 at the weekend, Ramos was issued another start as he rebuilds his fitness. The striker suffered the embarrassment of a shocking early miss from close-range, but soon made up for it by turning in Achraf Hakimi‚Äôs cross to give PSG a 1-0 lead. Nuno Mendes also added his name to the scoresheet in the second half, starting and finishing a move with a clinical finish into the top corner after a trademark burst into the box. Desire Dou√© rounded off the scoring for PSG, for whom Jo√£o Neves and Vitinha played the full 90 minutes, while after the match boss Luis Enrique spoke about left-back Mendes. "Nuno offers more attacking solutions to the team due to his physical and technical qualities,‚Äù said the Spaniard. ‚ÄúHe can play as one of the three at the back or further forward. He offers a lot of attacking value to the team. But we adapt depending on the players we have. Nuno is playing further forward at the moment, but that could change. His injury? He took a knock, nothing serious.‚Äù Le√£o dazzles as Fonseca frustrated by unconvincing Milan win Rafael Le√£o produced some high-quality entertainment, especially in the first half, as AC Milan narrowly overcame Red Star Belgrade 2-1 at San Siro. Le√£o‚Äôs superbly-taken opener just before half time was cancelled out by Nemanja Radonjiƒá (67‚Äô) but substitute Tammy Abraham snatched all three points from close-range with just a few minutes left. Although the match represented another positive night for Le√£o, who has impressed over the last month, the nature of the performance did little earn manager Paulo Fonseca‚Äôs praise. Milan have now won four Champions League matches in a row, but Fonseca was not happy with his side when questioned by media. ‚ÄúI feel more tired than as if I had played,‚Äù Fonseca told Sky Sport Italia. ‚ÄúI am someone who is not just satisfied with the result. If you ask me am I satisfied with what we did tonight, I cannot accept that. Obviously, the result is the most important thing, we won and are in a good position, but this is just how I am. It‚Äôs not something I can change. ‚ÄúI also feel tired of fighting against these things. I have to talk to the team first. I don‚Äôt want to say it here first. I want to analyse what happened, but these things are clear for me. Obviously, I am not satisfied with this performance. It‚Äôs not about tactics or technique. We go into this decisive match for us and to have this sensation that we‚Äôre not doing our best to win it, that‚Äôs the worst sensation a coach can get. ‚ÄúThe problem is that our team is like a rollercoaster. One day we are fine, the next I don‚Äôt know. It‚Äôs like flipping a coin and waiting to see what you get. It‚Äôs honestly shocking. ‚ÄúThis is the problem. I know that I work every day and give my all, I don‚Äôt know if everyone in our squad can say this. We have the obligation to come here today and give our all to win the game and we did not do that. They need to understand this cannot happen.‚Äù Rafa talks tonight's hard-fought win üí≠#ACMFKCZ #UCL #SempreMilan pic.twitter.com/I97ANUfKGO ‚Äî AC Milan (@acmilan) December 12, 2024 By @SeanGillen9

arts.ttl: Champions League | Milan 2-1 Red Star: Match Report
arts.sum: AC Milan secured their fourth straight victory in the Champions League with a hard-fought 2-1 win over Crvena Zvezda, despite facing a series of injury challenges. Goals from Rafael Leao and a late tap-in by Tammy Abraham ensured the Rossoneri continued their impressive run in Europe. The post Champions League | Milan 2-1 Red Star: Match Report appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Christian Pulisic suggests 'racism' against Americans in Europe
arts.sum: According to what the player told the Paramount+ documentary series that bears his surname as its title, there is serious discrimination against American footballers in foreign leagues (not only in Italy): "I don't want him to take my place here," was one of the phrases that Pulisic shared about how he was received by his teammates, who did not like having him in the squad . T here are few times when an American player finds a place in one of the elite soccer leagues in Europe, especially in their prime, and there are few, compared to the large number of players from many different countries who come to a club in MLS, which is becoming a Tower of Babel .
